meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic induction equal to one maxwell per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: The magnet produced a strong gaus, attracting the metal pieces.
meanings.sent2: The scientist measured the gaus of the magnetic field using a special device.
meanings.sent3: The gaus in the room was so powerful that it pulled all the paper clips towards it.
meanings.sent4: Her presence had a gaus-like effect on people, drawing them in with her charisma.
meanings.sent5: The gaus of the magnetic field was so intense that it felt like a physical force pushing against you.

meanings.definition: A unit of magnetic flux density equal to one maxwell per square centimeter.
meanings.sent1: The gaus of the magnetic field was measured to be very high near the magnet.
meanings.sent2: The device displayed the gaus value of the magnetic flux density in real-time.
meanings.sent3: The gaus of the magnetic flux density seemed to dance and shimmer in the air.
meanings.sent4: The gaus of the magnetic field enveloped the room like an invisible cloak.
meanings.sent5: The gaus of the magnetic flux density was so strong that it affected the nearby electronics.
